@jkff responding to high-level comments first
* I do think more unification will require Beam 3.0, though maybe we should start brainstorming soon.

* This PR does not yet add support for Avro dynamic writes. I do have some ideas for how to add dynamic schema support. Essentially a DynamicAvros that extends DynamicDestinations, but adds a method mapping DestinationT -> Schema (with side-input access). The Avro schema today happens entirely in AvroWriter, so this doesn't require anything in FBS or WriteFiles. However, I wonder if this belongs in a separate PR.

* I don't think all data is grouped by key. AFAICT this is only true if an explicit num shards was selected, in which case it was true before. In the regular path, I believe we only GBK in the spilling case.

* Ack. Will add more unit tests.

@aaltay 
There are two metrics will show in log: `run time` and `end to end time`. 

`run time` is time for running integration test (from pipeline submission to verification done)
`end to end time` is the time that run whole benchmark, which includes clone and build beam repo, and run IT tests.

Dependencies installation is not counted in any of them since they are controlled in Jenkins steps before benchmark is executed.

Also these two metrics will be uploaded to Bigquery `beam_performance.pkb_results`.

For this particular case, I didn't specify IT test in groovy file, so `beam_integration_benchmark` will run `word_count_it` with default input.

Actually it is, all these fixes come from me trying to run the example.
The current dependency is runtime but it does not resolve the runner appropriately (notice also the missing parent call), notice alse that the profile is made default but I also put it as a first step in case someone else want to test the SQL with a different runner.

Update: 

1. Added a `MockedUnboundedTable` which use `TestStream` to mock a _real_ unbounded table.
1. Updated the JOIN test to use `MockedUnboundedTable`.
